docs.lead_paragraph: Gail Collins: David, I loved your column this week about the Obama health care plan. I think it was really on target about the White House's politically pragmatic strategy. Our only difference appears to be that my reaction is -- Yes, Barack, go for whatever you can get! While I'm under the impression that you think whatever he gets is going to be too big, too bureaucratic, too messy, and that you'd be happy to see the whole thing defeated.
docs.abstract: What happens when Congress takes on health care reform.
docs.snippet: What happens when Congress takes on health care reform.

byline.original: By DAVID BROOKS AND GAIL COLLINS

docs.lead_paragraph: In 1993, George McGovern, of all people, wrote an essay that I wish more people would read, especially the people who are now running things in Washington.

headline.main: How the Stimulus Package Discourages Hiring

docs.abstract: Even after the economy improves, changes to Cobra and unemployment compensation will make me think long and hard before I hire anyone.
docs.snippet: Even after the economy improves, changes to Cobra and unemployment compensation will make me think long and hard before I hire anyone.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama sent out an e-mail message on Tuesday raising money for a nationwide grass-roots campaign to pass health legislation.

headline.main: Obama Raises Funds for Health Care Agenda

docs.abstract: The president issues an e-mail appeal to his massive list of supporters, attempting to raise funds to promote his health care agenda.
docs.snippet: The president issues an e-mail appeal to his massive list of supporters, attempting to raise funds to promote his health care agenda.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

docs.lead_paragraph: Senate Democrats and the White House struggled on Tuesday to respond to an initial financial analysis by the Congressional Budget Office showing that a main proposal for overhauling health care would cost $1 trillion over 10 years but would leave millions of Americans uninsured.

headline.main: Democrats Defend Health Care Plans, Despite Cost Estimate

docs.abstract: Senators on the Finance Committee indicated they would delay releasing their draft of a health care bill, after a nonpartisan agency issued what they considered disappointment estimates of costs.
docs.snippet: Senators on the Finance Committee indicated they would delay releasing their draft of a health care bill, after a nonpartisan agency issued what they considered disappointment estimates of costs.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ROBERT PEAR

docs.lead_paragraph: As many as 7 million Americans have long-term care insurance policies, and many states confronting burgeoning deficits are urging consumers to buy this type of insurance as a way to protect Medicaid budgets. But at a recent Senate hearing, lawmakers and watchdog groups cautioned that greater consumer protections are needed.

headline.main: Congress Airs Concerns on Long-Term Care Insurance

docs.abstract: A senator calls for greater protections for purchasers of long-term care insurance policies.
docs.snippet: A senator calls for greater protections for purchasers of long-term care insurance policies.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration continues to multi-task on several domestic policy fronts on Tuesday, as it prepares to unveil new financial oversight regulations and pushes its health care and climate change agenda on Capitol Hill.

headline.main: The Early Word: Juggling Reform Measures

docs.abstract: Health care, financial regulatory oversight, climate change all swirl in the foreground of legislative priorities.
docs.snippet: Health care, financial regulatory oversight, climate change all swirl in the foreground of legislative priorities.

headline.main: Text: Obama Interview with John Harwood

docs.lead_paragraph: As president, you’ve inherited a health care system that is the insane spawn of a team of evil geniuses from an alien power. How will you fix the mess?
docs.snippet: As president, you’ve inherited a health care system that is the insane spawn of a team of evil geniuses from an alien power. How will you fix the mess?

docs.lead_paragraph: Victims of the $65 billion Ponzi scheme sent more than 100 letters and e-mail messages to the judge in the case, ahead of Bernard L. Madoff’s sentencing, set for June 29.

headline.seo: Fraud Victims Want Maximum for Madoff
headline.main: Fraud Victims Want Maximum for Madoff
headline.print_headline: Fraud Victims Want Maximum for Madoff

docs.lead_paragraph: A new program aims to help employers avoid layoffs by reducing their workers’ hours and pay. For employees, state unemployment funds help make up the difference.

headline.seo: To Avoid Layoffs, Some Companies Turn to Work-Sharing
headline.main: Work-Sharing May Help Companies Avoid Layoffs

docs.snippet: A new program aims to help employers avoid layoffs by reducing their workers’ hours and pay. For employees, state unemployment funds help make up the difference.
